content:
### EXISTING STRUCTURES
### Iron Ore Mine at position(x=-17.0, y=-50.0)
Consists of following entities
-  Burner mining drill (position x=-17.0, y=-50.0) and a transport belt at position(x=-16.5 y=-51.5)
-  Burner mining drill (position x=-15.0, y=-50.0) and a transport belt at position(x=-14.5 y=-51.5)
-  Burner inserter (position x=-13.5, y=-50.5) that puts into a transport belt at position(x=-13.5 y=-51.5)
-  Burner inserter (position x=-13.5, y=-48.5) that puts into a transport belt at position(x=-12.5 y=-48.5)

### Iron Plate Factory at position(x=-10.0, y=-49.0)
Consists of following entities
-  Furnace (position x=-10.0, y=-49.0) that smelts iron ore into iron plate
-  Transport belt (position x=-12.5, y=-48.5) that connects the furnace to the iron ore mine
-  Burner inserter (position x=-16.5, y=-46.5) that puts iron ore into the furnace

### Storage at position(x=-16.5, y=-47.5)
Consists of a wooden chest (position x=-16.5, y=-47.5) that stores items

### ERROR TIPS
### Errors when using inserter but being too far
-  Make sure to move to the target entity where you want to insert items before inserting items
### Errors when placing into a tile which is occupied by another entity
- Ensure you can place a entity to a tile before attempting placing
### Errors when trying to get an entity that does not exist
- Make sure the entity exists at the specified position before trying to get it
### Errors when trying to insert items into an entity that cannot accept them
- Make sure the entity can accept the items you are trying to insert before inserting them
### Errors when using pickup_entity but the item is not an Entity or Prototype object
- Make sure the item is an Entity or Prototype object before trying to pick it up

### NAMESPACE
* Important variables:
  - `wooden-chest`: `int` (number of wooden chests in inventory)
  - `transport-belt`: `int` (number of transport belts in inventory)
  - `burner-mining-drill`: `int` (number of burner mining drills in inventory)
  - `stone-furnace`: `int` (number of stone furnaces in inventory)
  - `coal`: `int` (number of coal in inventory)
  - `iron-ore`: `int` (number of iron ore in inventory)
  - `iron-plate`: `int` (number of iron plates in inventory)
